intro: Erophila microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited ericoid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heaths and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. Its leaves are leathery and glossy, adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Erophila microcarpa is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, demonstrating a high degree of ecological resilience.
